verses.text: 你們要在錫安吹號，並在我的聖山發出警訊，讓國中所有的居民都戰慄，因為耶和華的日子快到，必然臨近了。

words.note: Often used in religious context for end times

verses.text: 那日是黑暗幽冥的日子，是密雲漆黑的日子。有一隊眾多強盛的民來到，好像晨光滿布群山；這樣的事從前沒有發生過，以後直到萬代，也不會發生。

words.note: Lit. 'ten thousand generations'

verses.text: 在他們前面有吞滅的火，在他們後面有燃燒的火燄；他們未到以前，大地像伊甸園，他們過去以後，大地成了荒涼的曠野，沒有一樣能逃避他們的。

words.note: Common in biblical texts to refer to desert areas

verses.text: 他們的形狀像馬的形狀，戰馬怎樣奔跑，他們也怎樣奔跑。
他們在群山頂上跳躍的聲音，如戰車的響聲，又如火燄吞滅碎稭的響聲，像強盛的民擺陣預備作戰。

words.definition: fight a battle, engage in combat

verses.text: 在他們面前，萬民苦惱，人人臉紅耳赤。

words.note: Refers to all people groups or nations.
Reduplication indicates 'every' or 'each'.
Idiom describing a state of extreme embarrassment or anger, flushed complexion.

verses.text: 他們奔跑像勇士，又像戰士爬上城牆；他們各按自己的路前行，並不偏離路線。

words.note: Often refers to mighty men or champions in biblical contexts.
Often used before 不/沒有 to emphasize the negation.

verses.text: 他們彼此不擁擠，各按自己的道前行；甚至他們持著兵器跌倒，也不會被剪除。

words.note: Often used in the Bible for divine judgment, meaning to be eliminated or cut off from a people.

verses.text: 他們衝入城鎮，奔上城牆，爬進房屋，像盜賊一樣從窗戶爬進去。

words.note: Used after a noun or pronoun to indicate similarity ('as... as', 'like').
進去 indicates movement inward and away from the speaker/reference point.

verses.text: 在他們面前，大地震動，諸天搖撼，日月昏暗，星星無光。

words.note: A formal or poetic term for 'the heavens' or 'all the heavens'.
Reduplication forms plural or emphasizes 'many stars'.

verses.text: 耶和華在他的軍隊前頭發出聲音；他的隊伍極大，成就他話語的，是強盛的人。耶和華的日子偉大，非常可畏，誰能忍受得住呢？
神耶和華說：「現在雖然如此，你們仍要全心全意，以禁食、哭泣、哀號，歸向我。」

words.note: The leading space is a traditional Chinese Bible reverence marker.
An idiom meaning wholeheartedly.
Often used in religious contexts for turning to God.

verses.heading: An Appeal for Repentance

verses.text: 你們要撕裂你們的心腸，不要撕裂你們的衣服。並要歸向耶和華你們的 神，因為他有恩典有憐憫，不輕易發怒，並且有豐盛的慈愛，隨時轉意不降災禍。

words.note: Figurative: the seat of emotions.
Often used in religious contexts for turning to God.
The leading space is a traditional Chinese Bible reverence marker.

verses.text: 有誰知道或許他會轉意，並且施慈愛，留下餘福，就是留下獻給耶和華你們的 神的素祭和奠祭。

words.note: The leading space is a traditional Chinese Bible reverence marker.

verses.text: 你們要在錫安吹號角，把禁食的日子分別為聖，召開嚴肅會。

words.definition: to consecrate, set apart as holy
words.note: Religious term for sanctification.

verses.text: 你們要召集民眾，使會眾分別為聖；招聚老人，聚集孩童，和在懷中吃奶的嬰孩；讓新郎從新房出來，新婦從內室出來。

words.definition: to consecrate, set apart as holy
words.note: A common biblical idiom for consecration.

verses.text: 讓事奉耶和華的祭司在聖殿的廊子和祭壇之間哭泣，讓他們說：「耶和華啊！求你憐恤你的子民。不要使你的產業受羞辱，使他們在列國中成為笑談。為甚麼容人在萬民中譏笑說：『他們的 神在哪裡呢？』」

words.note: Commonly used for serving God or superiors in religious contexts.
Often refers to God's chosen people or land in the Bible.
Capitalized for God; lowercased for 'gods'.

verses.text: 於是耶和華為了自己的地發熱心，憐恤他的子民。

words.note: In a biblical context, describes God's passionate concern.

verses.heading: The \nd \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*’s Response

verses.text: 耶和華應允他的子民，對他們說：「看哪！我必賜給你們五穀、新酒和新油，你們必吃得飽足，我必不再使你們成為列國中的羞辱。
我要使北方來的軍隊遠離你們；我要把他們驅逐到乾旱荒涼之地，他們的前隊趕入東海，他們的後隊趕入西海；並且他們的臭氣上升，他們的腥味上騰，因為耶和華行了大事。

words.note: A more poetic or vigorous 'rise' than 上升.

verses.text: 地土啊！你不要懼怕；你要歡喜快樂，因為耶和華行了大事。

words.note: Often used in biblical context for the earth/land.
A more formal or literary word for 'fear'.
A compound of two synonyms for joy/happiness, emphasizing the feeling.

verses.text: 田野的走獸啊，你們不要懼怕，因為曠野的草場又發青了，樹木又結果子了，無花果樹和葡萄樹也都效力了。

words.note: A more formal or literary word for 'fear'.
Common in biblical contexts.
A common verb-object compound, often used metaphorically in scripture.
In this context, it refers to trees bearing their fruit effectively.

verses.text: 錫安的人民哪！你們要歡喜，要靠耶和華你們的 神快樂，因為他賜給了你們合時的秋雨。他給你們降下時雨，就是秋雨春雨，像以前一樣。

words.note: When referring to the singular, capital-G God.
Here functions as a verb or predicate adjective following 'be'.
Refers to the 'early rains' important for agriculture in ancient Israel.
Refers to the 'early rains' important for agriculture in ancient Israel.
Refers to the 'latter rains' important for agriculture in ancient Israel.

verses.text: 禾場上必滿了五穀；榨酒池與油醡必溢出新酒與新油。

words.note: Refers to the five main grains of ancient China, but often generally means 'all grains'.

verses.text: 我差遣到你們中間去的，我的大軍隊，就是蝗蟲、蝻子、螞蚱和剪蟲，在那些年間吃盡的，我必補給你們。

words.note: Refers to a type of insect that 'cuts' or devours crops.

verses.text: 你們必吃得豐富，並且飽足，你們就讚美耶和華你們的 神的名，因為他為你們行了奇妙的事。我的子民必永遠不會羞愧。

words.note: Indicates the result of the preceding verb.
The space often denotes reverence for God in Chinese Bibles.
Refers to God's chosen people.

verses.text: 這樣，你們必知道我是在以色列中間，又知道我是耶和華你們的 神，除了我再沒有別的神。我的子民必永遠不會羞愧。

words.note: The space often denotes reverence for God in Chinese Bibles.
Refers to God's chosen people.

verses.text: 「以後，我要把我的靈澆灌所有的人。你們的兒女要說預言，你們的老年人要作異夢，你們的少年人要見異象。

words.note: Refers to God's Spirit in this context.
Often used for the pouring out of the Holy Spirit.
Refers to prophetic dreams.
Refers to prophetic visions.

verses.heading: An Outpouring of the Spirit

verses.text: 在那些日子，我也要把我的靈澆灌我的僕人和婢女。

words.note: Refers to God's Spirit in this context.
Often used for the pouring out of the Holy Spirit.
Often refers to a servant of God.
Female servant, often in a biblical context.

verses.text: 我要在天上地下顯出神蹟奇事，有血、有火、有煙柱。
太陽將變為黑暗，月亮將變為血紅。在耶和華偉大可畏的日子臨到以前，這一切都要發生。

words.note: A transliteration of the Hebrew name for God.
Often paired with 偉大 (great) in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 那時，求告耶和華的名的，都必得救；因為正如耶和華所說的，在錫安山和耶路撒冷必有得救的人，在劫後餘生的人中，必有耶和華所呼召的。」

words.note: Often used in biblical contexts for calling on God's name.
A transliteration of the Hebrew name for God.
A transliteration of the Hebrew name for God.
Zion, a hill in Jerusalem, often symbolic of God's presence.
Lit. 'remaining life after calamity'.
A transliteration of the Hebrew name for God.
Often used in religious contexts for God's calling.
Measure word for sections or verses in text.
The authoritative Hebrew text of the Jewish Bible.
